data.title: Support for grammar scopeName based activation hooks
data.body:
At the moment Atom supports `activationHooks` like `${packageName}:grammar-used`, but these only work on package level and not on the level of the actual grammar. This has two downsides:
1. If a package defines multiple grammars, the `activationHooks` will be triggered for any grammar. An example for this is the `language-java` package.
2. if multiple packages define the same grammar, a package that should be activated if this grammar is used has to add `activationHooks` for every package and update the `activationHooks` if a new package implements that grammar. An example for this is the `language-javascript` and `language-babel` package.

I think it wound be best to have another activation hook that works on the `scopeName` of a grammar. Something like: `${scopeName}:grammar-scope-used`.

data.title: Atom constantly crashes when it starts on 16.04
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

### Description

Ever since updating to 1.15 I have not been able to start atom. I window does not even appear. it's a fairly instant crash. I have removed the package. purged the package. mv ~/atom to ~/atom-backup. Re-Install/Installed dozens of times


### Steps to Reproduce

1. start atom
( or start atom in safe mode)


**Expected behavior:** atom to start

**Actual behavior:** atom does not start and crashes. A window never even appears.

**Reproduces how often:**  everytime

### Versions

Atom    : 1.15.0
Electron: 1.3.13

Node    : 6.5.0

apm -v

npm  3.10.5

python 2.7.12

(uname 4.4.0-72-generic)

Any additional information, configuration or data that might be necessary to reproduce the issue.

data.title: Refine Dock UX and API
data.body:
* [x] Allow docks to be auto-resized by double clicking the resize handle
* [x] Don't open docks when single-clicking the resize handle
* [x] Docks have a `getElement` method, but other workspace classes still use the legacy view provider system. Add `getElement` methods on those classes instead, and get rid of all the remaining view providers in core.
* [x] Add Workspace APIs for tracking which pane container is focused: `getActivePaneContainer`, `onDidChangeActivePaneContainer`.
* [x] Make workspace methods like `getActivePane` return panes in docks if docks are focused.

data.title: Small  Open File Bug
data.body:
Hi, 

Not sure if this a bug or just a feature, but file->'open' does not work unless a window is already open. Thought it might be something to make more standard with most editors.

data.title: Stops responding if an open (large) file gets edited by other program (ex. GitHub or notepad)
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [x ] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=‚úì&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Atom doesn't want to cooperate with me in the following case: 
I have a large file open, about 41.000 lines with averagely 130 characters on each.
I go into git, I  commit my stuff, and checks out to a different branch.
The file is changed by git. When Atom detects that, it freezes.
Was easily re-createable in safe mode, by opening the file, entering notepad opening the same file, do changes and save.
_I couldn't find any related issues, sorry if I have missed any_

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open Atom, load a rather large file. (_Mine was 41k lines, 1920 kb in size_)
2. Open a second text editor, open the same file, and add one character (or just do any change to it). Save the file
3. Switch back to Atom, and see that the editor hangs for quite a long time. I am haven't been able to return to my work without closing the editor first (unresponsive).

**Expected behavior:** I expected the file to be re-buffered such as in other text editors. (_at least get prompted about it_)

**Actual behavior:** The program freezes and goes unresponsive. 

**Reproduces how often:** 95-100%

### Versions
```
Atom    : 1.15.0
Electron: 1.3.13
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0
```

### Additional Information

I have deleted the storage folder, reinstalled Atom, attempted safe mode. Reproduces every time, no matter wich OS. _(Ubuntu 16.04 64-bit and Windows 10 Education 64-bit)_

data.title: Save / Save As dialog opens in the background
data.body:
### Description

The Save / Save As dialog opens in the background. 
Also mentioned here: https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13978#issuecomment-286096819

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open atom in safe mode
2. Create new file
3. Press File  > Save / Save As... or ctrl + s / ctrl + shift + s
4. Save dialog is opened in foreground
5. Close dialog
6. Press File  > Save / Save As... or ctrl + s / ctrl + shift + s

**Expected behavior:**
Dialog to open in foreground.

**Actual behavior:**
Dialog opens in background from then on.

### Versions
```
$ atom --version
Atom    : 1.15.0
Electron: 1.3.13
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0

$ apm --version
apm  1.15.3
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5 x64
python 2.7.12
git 2.7.4
```

I'm running Elementary OS 0.4 Loki (based on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS).

data.title: Document pane item interface on Workspace
data.body: We didn't have a single listing of all the workspace item methods. Thought with the new docks feature landing it was a good time.

data.title: Open docks when activating their panes, but not when adding items
data.body: Depends on https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14125

data.title: üìù Minor edits to CONTRIBUTING.md
data.body: This pull request proposes minor edits to `CONTRIBUTING.md` (e.g., [removing an extraneous word](https://github.com/atom/atom/commit/a36b6c4bd30d378f3b734631e00c0b3bc8b4f1d2), [fixing subject/verb agreement](https://github.com/atom/atom/commit/3f98ce2ac8facd5db5e4295a515369b568759e09), etc.). Each commit proposes a single edit, and the commit message aims to explain the proposed change.

data.title: Don't store default locations
data.body:
### Description of the Change

Previously, when an item was moved, we would store the location in a StateStore. This updates that code to only store non-default values.

### Benefits

This reduces the noise in the DB and might be clearer for devs experimenting with default locations.

data.title: Reloading when running atom --clear-window-state causes data loss
data.body:

data.title: Got error when installing packages
data.body:
I download atom from the official website, and install it on my new machine. But I cannot install any packages. The following are the error message:

> gyp info it worked if it ends with ok
> gyp info using node-gyp@3.4.0
> gyp info using node@4.4.5 | darwin | x64
> gyp http GET https://atom.io/download/electron/v1.3.13/iojs-v1.3.13.tar.gz
> gyp WARN install got an error, rolling back install
> gyp ERR! install error 
> gyp ERR! stack Error: connect ETIMEDOUT 52.216.82.152:443
> gyp ERR! stack     at Object.exports._errnoException (util.js:870:11)
> gyp ERR! stack     at exports._exceptionWithHostPort (util.js:893:20)
> gyp ERR! stack     at TCPConnectWrap.afterConnect [as oncomplete] (net.js:1061:14)
> gyp ERR! System Darwin 16.1.0
> gyp ERR! command "/private/var/folders/9t/q9qfv2gx1rg3y5grwd1wzq_h0000gn/T/AppTranslocation/76BA49A4-BB19-47E6-9F9F-79AF191E933D/d/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/apm/bin/node" "/private/var/folders/9t/q9qfv2gx1rg3y5grwd1wzq_h0000gn/T/AppTranslocation/76BA49A4-BB19-47E6-9F9F-79AF191E933D/d/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/apm/node_modules/node-gyp/bin/node-gyp.js" "install" "--runtime=electron" "--target=1.3.13" "--dist-url=https://atom.io/download/electron" "--arch=x64" "--ensure"
> gyp ERR! cwd /Users/yujie/.atom
> gyp ERR! node -v v4.4.5
> gyp ERR! node-gyp -v v3.4.0
> gyp ERR! not ok 

Does it look like server errors?  I visit 52.216.82.152:443, and it directs to amazon website.

Thx very much for your attention.

data.title: Update build to pre-compile packages with per-package transpilation configs
data.body:
This allows us to bundle packages with per-package transpilation setups as allowed in #13101. It's very similar to the existing built-in Babel pre-transpilation, but looks in `package.json` for the `atomTranspilers` configuration and adds the appropriate `CompileCache` setup *before* we begin to transpile *any* paths.

/cc @kuychaco @as-cii

data.title: Find in buffer with only in selection option doesn't work correctly
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [ ] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=‚úì&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

The selection in the buffer is sometimes not recognized.
So it can happen that the text is not found at all because it is used some old selection before.
Or it can happen that no selection is recognized and text gets replaced in the whole buffer.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Select some text in the buffer
2. Press Ctrl + F to open the Find in buffer dialog.
3. Switch on the "Only in selection" option
4. Enter some text in the find line
5. See that the counter of found indexes is not correct.
6. If it is correct, play around with selections in the buffer, soon you'll see the problem.

**Expected behavior:** 

That it recognizes the changed selection in buffer without editing the find field.

**Actual behavior:** 

You have to disable the "Only in selection" option, do the selection in buffer and enable the option again. Or you have to change the find text field.

**Reproduces how often:** 

Every time.


### Versions

Windows 10 / also on Linux

Atom    : 1.15.0
Electron: 1.3.13
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0

apm  1.15.3
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5 ia32
python 3.6.0
git 2.9.2.windows.1
visual studio 2015

Atom shows files in my 'lib' directory in ctrl-p despite them being in .gitignore. It doesn't
show files in node_modules (also in .gitignore).

Image taken in `--safe` mode:

![image of .gitignore and atom editor](https://i.imgur.com/xHAKcrr.png)

### Steps to Reproduce

direction.

It shouldn't show files in the lib directory in ctrl-p.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]

It shows files in the lib directory in ctrl-p.

**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]

Always in this project.

You can get this information from copy and pasting the output of `atom --version` and `apm --version` from the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

```
Electron: 1.3.13
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82

```

### Additional Information

Let me know if you need more information, but it happens in `--safe` mode.

data.title: No text in the UI
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [x] Done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=‚úì&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

One day I launched Atom only to find out that all UI text is gone. By that I mean that the code editor is fine, but anywhere else (including preferences) there's no text.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15035286/24643135/4ff76b26-1925-11e7-9fdb-d39d1a990e11.png)
I haven't done any changes to Atom since the last time I launched it and it everything was fine back then.


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Launch Atom

**Expected behavior:** Text in the UI should render as usual

**Actual behavior:** It doesn't (see the screenshot for details)

**Reproduces how often:** Always occurs

### Versions

Running Ubuntu 16.04, issue seen in Atom 1.14.6 and still persists after an upgrade to the latest 1.15.0
```
Atom    : 1.15.0
Electron: 1.3.13
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0
```

### Additional Information

It's not any packages that cause this issue, because I've tried moving the `~/.atom` folder away

data.title: Allow workspace item objects to be passed to Workspace.open
data.body:
Currently, in order to add a given item to the workspace, there is some indirection involved. You must add an *opener* function that returns that item based on some URI, and then to call `Workspace.open` with that URI:

```js
const MY_URI = 'my-package://something'

atom.workspace.addOpener((uri) => {
  if (uri === MY_URI) return new MyItem()
})

atom.workspace.open(MY_URI)
```

The URIs are involved because the workspace uses them as a serializable identifier for the items. But often the indirection of the *opener* concept is unnecessary. This PR adds the ability to add a given item directly to the workspace:

```js
atom.workspace.open(myItem)
```

The item can still have a `getURI` method, so the workspace will still be able to identifiy it for purposes like [remembering which Dock you last placed it in](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/03be10414189b195ce4cbb9f11936cf575b15042/src/workspace.js#L688).

/cc @nathansobo @matthewwithanm

data.title: windows crashes consistantly with netio.sys bsod when accessing package repositories through atom settings menu with windows proxy enabled and running through charles
data.body:
Defect Description:

When the user is accessing the atom package repositories through the atom settings menu and as a prerequisite has a browser session running through a windows proxy through Charles windows crashes with a bsod and a netio.sys error 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. install charles proxy
2. install google chrome
3. setup windows proxy
4. create recording settings in charles with ssl enabled on a arbitrary test server
5. open the install packages menu in atom
6. search for and install a package
7. note windows crashes with bsod netio.sys error

Expected behavior:

windows does not crash when accessing package repository in atom while simultaneously recording proxy traffic

Actual behavior:

windows does not crash when accessing package repository in atom while simultaneously recording proxy traffic

Reproducible:  

100%

data.title: Fix issue #14109 and #13978
data.body:
First argument to dialog.showSaveDialog() needs to be a BrowserWindow

https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/master/docs/api/dialog.md
https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/master/lib/browser/api/dialog.js

### Requirements

* Filling out the template is required. Any pull request that does not include enough information to be reviewed in a timely manner may be closed at the maintainers' discretion.
* All new code requires tests to ensure against regressions

### Description of the Change

This should fix some regression introduced by commit https://github.com/atom/atom/commit/c6cae5b8fdfea982084b068a0b38a7c988c52f51 related to `showSaveDialog` causing things such "Save As", "Save as HTML" to not work properly (default filename "Untitled" and default path missing when it should be autofilled with more "reasonable" ones--e.g. original filename and path). 

This commit fixes the erroneous usage in [`src/main-process/atom-window.coffee#L268`](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/c6cae5b8fdfea982084b068a0b38a7c988c52f51/src/main-process/atom-window.coffee#L268) introduced in commit https://github.com/atom/atom/commit/c6cae5b8fdfea982084b068a0b38a7c988c52f51
```coffeescript
dialog.showSaveDialog(this, params)
```

Here, `this` refers to an instance of AtomWindow, when the function `dialog.showSaveDialog` requires the first argument to be a BrowserWindow [`electron/lib/browser/api/dialog.js#L24`](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/master/lib/browser/api/dialog.js#L24). 

So I believe the fix is simply 
```coffeescript
dialog.showSaveDialog(@browserWindow, params)
```

This is consistent with with the function binding usage in [`src/main-process/atom-window.coffee#L86@c6cae5b`](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/c6cae5b8fdfea982084b068a0b38a7c988c52f51/src/main-process/atom-window.coffee#L86) and with the **old** working function `showSaveDialog` in [`src/application-delegate.coffee#L158`](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/ae9d949ee4e199d1884bed89083196fa375bbd34/src/application-delegate.coffee#L158)

<!--

We must be able to understand the design of your change from this description. If we can't get a good idea of what the code will be doing from the description here, the pull request may be closed at the maintainers' discretion. Keep in mind that the maintainer reviewing this PR may not be familiar with or have worked with the code here recently, so please walk us through the concepts.

-->

### Alternate Designs

N/A
<!-- Explain what other alternates were considered and why the proposed version was selected -->

### Why Should This Be In Core?

Bug fix.
<!-- Explain why this functionality should be in atom/atom as opposed to a package -->

### Benefits

Fixes bug (and see applicable issues)
<!-- What benefits will be realized by the code change? -->

### Possible Drawbacks

I cannot think of any at this moment.
<!-- What are the possible side-effects or negative impacts of the code change? -->

### Applicable Issues

- https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/14109
- https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13978
